newsitem.title: UK: IPE oil futures fall after WTI-led plunge.
newsitem.headline: IPE oil futures fall after WTI-led plunge.

text.p: IPE crude futures sank to a new session low on Thursday on the back of weaker-than-expected NYMEX crude, traders said.
August Brent was trading 31 cents down at $17.91 a barrel by 1501 GMT after sinking to as low as $17.85 after NYMEX opened.
NYMEX's WTI August contract, called to open 10 to 15 cents a barrel lower, was trading 28 cents on the downside at $19.18 after sinking to a session low of $19.07.
"We've been totally dominated by the WTI which has tried its support level," one trader said.

"We've reached support at the opening but now it is rising back up. When it went through the first support level that's when we started coming down. It's a mirror image of this morning when it (Brent) fell then retraced back up," the trader added.
Dealers were waiting for fresh news about when Iraq would resume its oil exports under its oil-for-food deal with the United Nations.
July gas oil expired at $1.25 down at $161.25 and the new front month, August slipped further some 25 cents to $1.50 a tonne lower at $161.75.
